report_title: Online Industrial Supplies Sales Industry Report
executive_summary: Companies in the Online Industrial Supplies Sales industry offer a wide range of industrial supplies, including abrasives, containers and valves, mainly to manufacturing, mining, construction and wholesaling industries. Industry enterprises benefit from circumstances that accelerate e-commerce sales and drive more consumers to online marketplaces, such as the COVID-19 pandemic. Overall, industry revenue is expected to climb at an annualized rate of 3.5% to an estimated $26.7 billion over the five years to 2023, despite a 1.4% drop in 2023 alone, as profit slides to 3.6%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry Revenue Has Been Significantly Affected By Volatile Commodity Prices And Uncertain Economic Conditions
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Following collapsing commodity prices in 2020, a recovery in the value of crude oil has driven overall revenue generation for industry enterprises. In 2020 alone, the industrial production index took a sharp decline as the COVID-19 pandemic drove additional business activity, disrupted supply chains and introduced retail and manufacturing regulations, which put pressure on manufacturing activity.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online Sales Environment Continues to Expand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Lower costs and more efficient systems have made online retailers more accessible, which has encouraged buyers to make more of their purchases online. Online retailers, including those in this industry, owe much of their success to the development of secure payment methods, which add a practical component to the "shop anytime, anywhere" spirit of the online marketplace.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online Industrial Supplies Sales Growth Necessitates More Employees And Higher Wages
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industry enterprises have been rapidly developing their online store platforms to make placing orders as easy and safe as possible for businesses. Many of these developments have focused on improving front-end design and user efficiency, which has resulted in increased traffic. As new companies enter and existing companies expand, employment numbers have mounted. Similarly, total wages have increased as industry enterprises hire highly skilled and tech-savvy employees to help implement the latest technological developments on their e-commerce platforms.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: External Threats Challenge Continued Industry Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Broad improvements in the US economy following the pandemic are expected to fuel downstream markets, such as manufacturing and warehousing, resulting in steady growth for the Online Industrial Supplies Sales industry. Demand from industries, such as the Car and Automobile Manufacturing industry, should improve as commodity prices stabilize and supply chain disruptions ease.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry Participants Compete Based on Service Capabilities, Reputation, Reliability and Price
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Enterprises have started to offer service-based products, such as inventory management, product repair, energy services and safety services. For example, Grainger uses these services to attract new customers and offer one-stop shopping to existing clients.

Moving forward, the number of industry enterprises is expected to continue to proliferate amid positive online consumer shopping trends and increasing revenue, particularly as downstream economic activity resumes. New entrants will look to capitalize on the gains to be made from having an online presence for their products.

industry_definition: This industry sells industrial supplies primarily at the wholesale level where the majority of customers are manufacturers, contractors, warehouse operators and government entities. These products include abrasives, electrical products, tools and hydraulics. Some companies also provide services such as inventory management, product repair, energy services and safety services.

mixed_impact_factors: Medium - Increasing Barriers To Entry Level

key_trends: Revenue was negatively affected by declines in commodity prices and low demand
As online security has improved, customers have been more inclined to shop there
Despite positive trends, rising wage costs and competition have pulled profit down
Broad economic improvements are expected to continue fueling downstream markets
E-commerce trends will boost customer demand and external competition
Operator and employee numbers are forecast to expand amid positive demand
Increased e-commerce activity has helped operators compete and stay afloat

market_segmentation.segment_description: Industrial businesses, mainly mining and manufacturing customers, purchase industry products as inputs into their production processes. Products demanded from this market include abrasives, inks, rubber goods, bearings and bushings as well as hydraulic power systems and cams.

Other wholesalers turn to suppliers in this industry when sourcing items or restocking inventory. Some wholesalers specialize in a particular brand or product and position themselves as the sole supplier for downstream industries in their geographic market.

Independent businesses demand this industry's products as operational inputs into their ongoing production processes. Valves and fittings for process equipment, bearings, bushings and other mechanical power-transmission supplies are necessary components.
All other customers include repair shops, governments, food service, farmers, households and miscellaneous markets. Contractors include building, heavy construction and special trade contractors.

products_and_services.product_description: Abrasive products include loose, bonded, coated and super abrasive tools for use in downstream manufacturing, aerospace, telecommunications and construction.

Mechanical power transmissions include hydraulic systems, which use liquid under pressure to transmit power. For example, hydroelectric power-generation facilities harness natural waterpower to lift ships or generate electricity.
This segment includes cargo containers, shipping containers, storage for cargo transport, packaging and labeling supplies and consumer items, such as boxes, bottles and cans.

Industrial valves include angle valves, automatic valves, ball valves, boiler-gauge cocks, butterfly valves, gas cylinder valves, fire hydrant valves, gas valves, globe valves, pressure-control valves, safety valves and solenoid valves.

tier_1_suppliers: Wind Turbine Manufacturing in the US
Power Tools & Other General Purpose Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Cardboard Box & Container Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Bottled Water Production in the US
tier_2_buyers: Construction Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Mining, Oil & Gas Machinery Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: As consumer spending and per capita disposable income rise, manufacturing activity increases similarly, taking its cue from larger orders placed by retailers and distribution channels.
Demand for industrial supplies is dictated by the price of industrial products, which at the manufacturing level, compete with imported goods.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is a prominent home to many industry enterprises. Business locations are strategically chosen to serve customers through a network of integrated distribution centers. The Southeast has seafood canning, bottling plants, distilleries, mining and manufacturing activity.

The Great Lakes region is home to many major automotive manufacturers, which this industry supplies. Equally, this industry consumes large amounts of steel and fabricated steel products that are readily available from the Great Lakes region.

The West is a major food-processing region, with California being the home to the greatest number of related establishments. The region's popularity is due to processors' proximity to fruits and vegetables and its seaports for export to Asia.

regulations_points.regulation_description: In recent years, the Online Industrial Supplies Sales industry has experienced increased regulation. In particular, demand for online retailing has been threatened by internet taxation regulation.

Industry enterprises must comply with shipping standards, such as not shipping restricted products or hazardous materials. E-commerce sites are subject to age restriction verification, which is not an issue for this industry.
Product standards fall into three categories: communication standards, design standards, and performance standards.
Industry enterprises that supply the US government must comply with certain laws and regulations relating to the formation, administration and performance of US government contracts.
Amid the pandemic, the industry had limited added regulation relative to other sectors as most regulations were aimed at slowing the spread of the virus by limiting exposure among employees.

factors_increased_barrier: Vertically integrated, large and scaled companies pose a barrier to success.
Overall, incumbent enterprises have a competitive advantage over nascent enterprises.
The pre-established distribution networks between companies and suppliers may, in some cases, be viewed as a barrier to entry.

basis_points.basis_description: Price is a critical point of competition due to the high volume, low-margin structure of industry enterprises.
Major players like W.W. Grainger offer vendor-managed inventory services by visiting organizations, analyzing replenishment needs, and managing the entire replenishment process.
Technological capabilities complement customer service capabilities, enabling robust product/service offerings like customer-managed inventory and vending systems.
Competition is based on breadth and quality of product/service offerings, availability, ease of selection/ordering, online capability, and product knowledge.
A website's ease of use, privacy, and security are crucial for competing effectively in the online marketplace.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry has a moderate level of market share concentration, in contrast to the brick-and-mortar marketplace which is dominated by small, local shops.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Prominent companies taking advantage of economies of scale
concentration_points.concentration_description: Large players like W.W. Grainger have increased their market share by increasing their share of total online sales.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Electronic inventory management software can improve industry operations by automating the order fulfillment process and monitoring inventory for restocking.
Many industry enterprises use an electronic data interchange (EDI) ordering system to support customers' purchase order processing.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Online shopping enterprises outlay capital on technology to establish, implement and maintain their websites on which consumers place orders.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The Industry Returns to More Consistent Growth
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry is expected to return to more consistent growth rates moving forward; however, operators may still experience some volatility as both the industry and the broader economy rebound from the lingering supply chain issues caused by the pandemic and ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Online Industrial Supplies Sales industry has not experienced significant technological disruption in recent years.
A rising number of broadband connections and smartphone devices has propelled e-commerce sales to new heights, particularly amid the surge in e-commerce activity during the pandemic.
In terms of computer equipment, online dealers must have a selling platform, hardware and the related software associated with keeping it updated and functioning at its highest capacity.

FAQs.question: Considering e-commerce has surged in recent years, how have your sales been affected by the growth of online shopping? How has online growth during the coronavirus pandemic affected sales?
FAQs.answer: The growth of online shopping is expected to increase sales over the next five years. During the COVID-19 pandemic, e-commerce and online business activity surged, with the percentage of business conducted online growing 19.4% in 2020 alone.

FAQs.question: Are your sales heavily dependent on any one market, major customer or other isolated revenue stream?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers are the largest market for companies seeking to sell industry goods. Diverse market segments have allowed companies to continue to expand in economic downturns such as the coronavirus pandemic's resulting recession.

FAQs.question: How do you manage volatile demand that results from economic conditions or seasonality?
FAQs.answer: Operators must follow demand from downstream markets carefully and adjust their inventories accordingly.

FAQs.question: How does your company negotiate favorable purchase costs with suppliers?
FAQs.answer: Companies must form good connections with suppliers in order to get favorable purchase prices. This is particularly important for volatile input costs, particularly as supply chain disruptions led to pricing surges following the pandemic.

FAQs.question: How has your company been able to implement technology into the purchasing process to make buying more efficient for customers?
FAQs.answer: Companies have upgraded their online experience by adding to the features a consumer can use, such as cleaner interfaces and more products for purchase.

FAQs.question: How are increased digitalization for businesses and the growing popularity of online shopping affecting your financial performance?
FAQs.answer: The growing popularity of online shopping is expected to continue to boost industry performance while brick-and-mortar sales falter.

FAQs.question: How have you adjusted to new regulations over the past decade? How have you handled compliance costs?
FAQs.answer: New regulations have not significantly impacted companies in this industry. However, companies have needed to comply with social distancing and mask mandates during the coronavirus pandemic, which have impaired productivity.

FAQs.question: How does your company monitor potential changes to the regulatory environment?
FAQs.answer: Companies follow trends in regulatory compliance by keeping up to date with rules and regulations.

FAQs.question: What immediate financial challenges are you likely to face in the next year as the global economy recovers from the coronavirus pandemic?
FAQs.answer: The biggest financial challenge to companies will involve input and commodity prices. As economic activity began to resume in 2021 as restrictions were lifted after the pandemic, many input and commodity prices surged as producers had been underprepared to meet demand.

FAQs.question: How has input price volatility affected your purchase costs and selling prices over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Input price volatility has led to declining purchase costs and lower selling prices over the past five years. However, inflation and input price increases in 2021 and early in the outlook period are expected to put upward pressure on purchase costs.

FAQs.question: How do you collect customer feedback? How do you encourage customer loyalty?
FAQs.answer: Having a loyal customer base. Loyal customers make repeat purchases. Establishing loyalty requires superior customer service, value-added products and competitive pricing. Smaller companies can benefit from customer loyalty, particularly as this industry is highly competitive with only a few companies dominating the market.

FAQs.question: Do you have fixed, long-term supply contracts with input suppliers? How can you diversify your product mix?
FAQs.answer: Having links with suppliers. Links with a diverse range of suppliers provide companies with a wider product range and greater target market. Having a diverse range of suppliers will mitigate price volatility.

FAQs.question: What technology-sharing arrangements are you currently a part of? How do you ensure that you have access to the latest technology?
FAQs.answer: Technology-sharing arrangements. Operators should share and invest in manufacturers' information to improve information systems for customer and supplier service.

FAQs.question: How do rising interest rates affect demand for your products? How do you encourage investment in industrial supplies when interest rates are high? How did the drop in interest rates during the COVID-19 pandemic affect demand?
FAQs.answer: Yield on 10-year Treasury note. This interest rate is typically used as a benchmark for interest rates offered by commercial banks, which is where most loans originate from. As this increases, so too does the effective borrowing cost associated with taking out a loan for investment.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the IPI? How have fluctuations in the IPI affected demand for your products? How have IPI fluctuations during the pandemic affected demand?
FAQs.answer: Industrial production index. The level of industrial production indicates the level of output within an industry. As the level of industrial production increases, so does demand for industrial supplies sold within this industry.

FAQs.question: How have you enhanced your online store over the past five years? How can you make your online presence more user-friendly? Have you benefited from the surge in online economic activity during the coronavirus pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Percentage of services conducted online. The percentage of services conducted online metric represents the number of services now offered via the internet. As the percentage of services online increases, so too does demand for industrial supplies sold online.
